name: Pirate Studios

description: All of our business is driven through our online booking system; however, we're also working on enhancing our customer's experience by integrating more technology into our studios. At Pirate Studios our artists, bands, DJ’s and producers can rehearse 24hrs a day, save their recorded sessions in the cloud, edit, download then share their songs and perform live streams to their fans across the globe.

jobs.title: Digital Project Manager/Product Owner
jobs.description:
Digital Project Manager/Product Owner

Role: Part/Full-time Digital Project Manager
Dept: Tech
Location: Bristol
Seniority level: Mid
Salary range: £27-37k (depending on experience)
Reporting to: Tom Trevithick & Sol Jubrail
Duration: Permanent

A little background information on Pirate Studios: 
 
As a canvas for creative expression, Pirate Studios believes it is everyone’s right to have around the clock access to high quality music equipment in our innovative spaces, so that live music can continue to flourish and expand, worldwide.  
 
We launched almost 3 years ago as the UK’s first self-service music rehearsal studios. Since then the business has grown into 19 sites across the UK, it has expanded into the US and Germany. 
 
All of our business is driven through our online booking system; however, we're also working on enhancing our customer's experience by integrating more technology into our studios. At Pirate Studios our artists, bands, DJ’s and producers can rehearse 24hrs a day, save their recorded sessions in the cloud, edit, download then share their songs and perform live streams to their fans across the globe.

About the Job

We're looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Digital Project Manager/Product Owner to  work as part of our tech team on various projects.

We're looking for someone to work in our Bristol office in Old Market however you may find yourself going to London or onsite once in a while.

Working alongside the current Digital PMs, you will support with the delivery of our exciting live streaming and recording services, new website, mobile app and develop new music related products.

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone wanting to apply their Project Management experience and skills in a highly dynamic and exciting industry.


Responsibilities

- Provide end-to-end project management across the entire project lifecycle to deliver successful projects and support the company’s continued growth.
- Apply Project Management methodologies effectively, to design, plan and deliver both Agile and Waterfall projects.
- Liaise with stakeholders and developers to gather requirements, and prioritise these effectively.
- Contribute to and help coordinate Sprint planning, Retrospectives and demonstrations.
- Identify and log all risks, issues and their solutions, to make sure that as a company, we only make mistakes once.
- Actively coordinate specific projects and changes, including outlining the user requirements, scoping solutions and delivering the required changes.
- Produce project documentation including project briefs, plans and reporting to ensure projects are communicated effectively and expectations are managed.
- Devise new processes to meet ever-changing business needs, and assist in their implementation across all involved departments.


Required Skills

Essential:

- Experience planning and delivering projects in a tech/digital environment to required cost, time and quality.
- Knowledge and understanding of both Agile/Scrum project and/or waterfall/Prince2 project management.
- Project documentation, reporting and planning with the ability to communicate these to a variety of stakeholders.
- Highly organised, with an ability to multitask on a wide number of ever-changing projects 
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with demonstrable experience utilising these across all levels of an organisation
- Skills and experience in engaging with a range of stakeholders for requirements gathering.
- Experience working with an equivalent of Microsoft Office or the Google Suite (particularly Excel / Sheets).
- Experience effectively identifying and managing risk.
- Solid practical or technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in IT or Digital Environment.
- Willingness to learn and develop.
- Enthusiastic with can do attitude and willing to go the extra mile when required.

Desired:

- Experience of designing and documenting new processes.
- Experience and knowledge of the role of a Product Owner, with the ability to gather requirements, and prioritise these accordingly.
- Experience managing QA and testing.
- Project Management Foundation certification (e.g. PRINCE II).
- Qualification or training in Agile/Scrum methodologies.
- An interest in music, and getting as many people playing as possible!
- Business Analysis including Process Mapping and Lean Thinking.
- Fluency with JIRA and other project management software.
- Experience of using MS Project or equivalent.
- Mobile application development experience.
- Web development experience.

Music

As a music start-up we obviously have a lot of staff who are excited about music, performance, or production. It's not a requirement but if that's your sorta thing then you’ll be surrounded by like-minded people sharing and collaborating.

 
Interested?

Send us your details and any questions. Give us an outline of who you are, what you do, what you enjoy, and any examples of your work.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Digital Project Manager/Product Owner

Role: Part/Full-time Digital Project Manager
Dept: Tech
Location: Bristol
Seniority level: Mid
Salary range: £27-37k (depending on experience)
Reporting to: Tom Trevithick & Sol Jubrail
Duration: Permanent

  • Apply Project Management methodologies effectively, to design, plan and deliver both Agile and Waterfall projects.
  • Liaise with stakeholders and developers to gather requirements, and prioritise these effectively.

  • Devise new processes to meet ever-changing business needs, and assist in their implementation across all involved departments.

  • Knowledge and understanding of both Agile/Scrum project and/or waterfall/Prince2 project management.
  • Project documentation, reporting and planning with the ability to communicate these to a variety of stakeholders.
  • Highly organised, with an ability to multitask on a wide number of ever-changing projects
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with demonstrable experience utilising these across all levels of an organisation

  • Experience working with an equivalent of Microsoft Office or the Google Suite (particularly Excel / Sheets).

  • Solid practical or technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in IT or Digital Environment.
  • Willingness to learn and develop.
  • Enthusiastic with can do attitude and willing to go the extra mile when required.

  • Project Management Foundation certification (e.g. PRINCE II).
  • Qualification or training in Agile/Scrum methodologies.
  • An interest in music, and getting as many people playing as possible!
  • Business Analysis including Process Mapping and Lean Thinking.
  • Fluency with JIRA and other project management software.
  • Experience of using MS Project or equivalent.
  • Mobile application development experience.
  • Web development experience.

Music

As a music start-up we obviously have a lot of staff who are excited about music, performance, or production. It's not a requirement but if that's your sorta thing then you’ll be surrounded by like-minded people sharing and collaborating.

Interested?

Send us your details and any questions. Give us an outline of who you are, what you do, what you enjoy, and any examples of your work.

We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Senior Search & Display Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Job Summary Core Responsibilities:
● Search, Display & Youtube form an integral part of Pirate Studios user acquisition strategy 
● This will be an all encompassing role, responsible for Pirate Studios paid Search, Display and Youtube efforts globally (US, EU, UK)
● Responsible for all paid search accounts (Adwords, Bing, Youtube) inc budgeting, reporting, optimisations and roll-out strategy
● Responsible for providing wider insight into the rest of the marketing team, to help lead on product decision
● Pirate Studios is expanding rapidly, both in it's product offering and in the locations we are live, this person will be taking on our global roll out, including building and scaling their own search marketing team as we grow


Job Type / Category:
Pirate Studios is the largest music, DJ and production studio provider in the world, with sites across the EU and US. We offer a unique self-service model that allows customers to rehearse 24/7 in our revolutionary new studios. Started in January 2016 we’re already live in 22 cities, 5 countries, and we have 28 new cities coming in 2019 across the world. We’re growing very rapidly and currently looking for someone that can fit into our fast paced culture to lead our search marketing growth in the UK, DE and US. If you’re looking to be part of one of the most exciting start ups to come out of the UK this year, then we’d love to hear from you. This is a rare opportunity to get involved in a startup that is about to go through hyper growth. Reporting into the Head of Marketing, the right person will develop and grow their own search marketing team as we scale. 

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2018/11/15/bristol-based-music-startup-pirate-raises-20m-self-service-studios/ 

https://techcrunch.com/2018/11/14/pirate-studios/ 


Required Education, Skills and Qualifications:
● Very hungry to be part of a hyper growth start-up 
● Someone that goes the extra mile to always over deliver 
● Someone that is well equipped in google analytics 
● Someone that is able to think pragmatically and logically 
● Someone that loves data, automation and everything about it 
● Someone that is constantly up to date with the latest marketing trends 
● Someone that has extremely strong Google Sheets/Excel skills 
● Very Experienced using Adwords in multiple languages 
● Very Experienced using Bing Advertising 
● Very Experienced usingGDN 
● Very Experienced in Youtube advertising for acquisition and channel growth 
● Experienced reporting to senior management 
● Love problem solving


Benefits:
● Pirate Studios is based worldwide so there will be lots of opportunity to travel and attend high profile events at our studios, festivals and with our partners 
● Pirate Studios is one of most exciting and fastest growing startups in the UK, join us now on our venture to go global 
● A very high paced, relaxed, but rewarding environment 
● Office is in Dalston, in our own office, equipped with bar, table football, table tennis, games consoles etc all the startup stuff... 
● Flexible working is encouraged, if you need to work out of the office for a day, we’re cool with that 
● Salary negotiable based on experience We’re very much looking forward to hear from you!
